text: Donovan Lloyd Sinclair (born 13 August 1985) is a Jamaican cricketer who has played for the Jamaica national team in West Indian domestic cricket. He is a right-arm leg-spin bowler. Sinclair made his senior debut for Jamaica in May 2006, playing a 50-over match against the touring Indians. He failed to take a wicket, finishing with 0/29 from six overs.India tour of West Indies, Tour Match: Jamaica v Indians at Montego Bay, May 16, 2006, ESPNcricinfo. Retrieved 3 September 2016. Sinclair's List A debut for Jamaica came in October 2007, against the Leeward Islands in the 2007–08 KFC Cup. He took 1/12 on debut and 2/20 in the next match against Barbados, but was not retained in the team for the finals.List A matches played by Donovan Sinclair, CricketArchive. Retrieved 3 September 2016. Sinclair made his first-class debut in May 2008, playing for a Jamaica Select XI against the touring Australians.First-class matches played by Donovan Sinclair, CricketArchive. Retrieved 3 September 2016. He took 3/14 from 6.3 overs in Australia's first innings, dismissing Brad Haddin, Mitchell Johnson, and Stuart MacGill.Australia tour of West Indies, Tour Match: Jamaica Select XI v Australians at Florence Hall, May 16-18, 2008, ESPNcricinfo. Retrieved 3 September 2016. He was subsequently retained in Jamaica's squad for the 2008–09 WICB Cup, but played only a single match, against Barbados. ==References== ==External links== *Player profile and statistics at CricketArchive *Player profile and statistics at ESPNcricinfo Category:1985 births Category:Living people Category:Jamaica cricketers Category:Jamaican cricketers Category:People from Saint Elizabeth Parish
title: Donovan Sinclair
